intro: Sibbaldia sericea, commonly known as the silky sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silky layer of hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sibbaldia sericea is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
